description: A regular rhythmic sound in music.
The words of a song.
A sequence of pleasing sounds in music.
A style or category of music.
When different notes are played together and sound nice.
The speed of the beat in music.
Music played without electric instruments.
A slow sentimental or romantic song.
The part of a song that's repeated after each verse.
A series of eight notes occupying the interval between two notes.
A composition for an instrumental soloist, often with a piano accompaniment.
A complex piece of music with parts repeated in different voices.
A disturbance or interruption of the regular flow of rhythm.
The character or quality of a musical sound or voice.
A lack of harmony among musical notes.
Playing the notes of a chord one after another.
A sequence of notes signaling the end of a piece of music.
A musical composition for a solo instrument accompanied by an orchestra.
A method of voice production used by male singers to sing higher notes.
In a smooth flowing manner, without breaks between notes.
A rapid, slight variation in pitch in singing or playing some musical instruments.
A short repeated phrase in popular music and jazz.
A compilation of favorite pieces of music, typically by different artists, recorded onto a cassette or CD.
An electronic device that records sounds and allows them to be altered.
An electronic instrument that generates audio signals to create music.
